010package imagingbook.common.ij;
011
012import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
013import java.net.URI;
014import java.util.ArrayList;
015import java.util.Arrays;
016import java.util.Comparator;
017import java.util.LinkedList;
018import java.util.List;
019import java.util.Objects;
020
021import ij.ImagePlus;
022import ij.WindowManager;
023import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
024import ij.io.OpenDialog;
025import ij.io.Opener;
026import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
027import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
028import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilterRunner;
029import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
030import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
031import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
032import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
033import ij.process.ShortProcessor;
034import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
035import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
036import imagingbook.common.util.bits.BitMap;

038
039/**
040 * This class defines static utility methods adding to ImageJs functionality.
041 * @author WB
042 *
043 */
044public abstract class IjUtils {
045        
046        private IjUtils() {}
047        
048        /**
049         * Returns a (possibly empty) array of ImagePlus objects that are
050         * sorted by their titles if the 'sortByTitle' flag is set.
051         * 
052         * @param sortByTitle flag, result is sorted if true.
053         * @return an array of currently open images.
054         */
055        public static ImagePlus[] getOpenImages(boolean sortByTitle) {
056                return getOpenImages(sortByTitle, null);
057        }
058        
059
060        /**
061         * Returns an array of strings containing the short titles
062         * of the images supplied.
063         * 
064         * @param images array of images.
065         * @return array of names.
066         */
067        public static String[] getImageShortTitles(ImagePlus[] images) {
068                String[] imageNames = new String[images.length];
069                for (int i = 0; i < images.length; i++) {
070                        imageNames[i] = images[i].getShortTitle();
071                }
072                return imageNames;
073        }
074        
075        /**
076         * Opens a dialog to let the user select one of the currently open images.
077         * @param title string to show in the dialog
078         * @return An ImagePlus object, use the getProcessor method to obtain the associated ImageProcessor
079         */
080        public static ImagePlus selectOpenImage(String title) {
081                ImagePlus[] openImages = getOpenImages(true, null);
082                String[] imageNames = getImageShortTitles(openImages);
083                if (title == null) {
084                        title = "image:";
085                }
086                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog("Select image");
087                gd.addChoice(title, imageNames, imageNames[0]);
088                gd.showDialog(); 
089                if (gd.wasCanceled()) 
090                        return null;
091                else {
092                        return openImages[gd.getNextChoiceIndex()];
093                }
094        }
095        
096        
097        /**
098         * Returns a (possibly empty) array of {@link ImagePlus} objects that are
099         * sorted by their titles if the sortByTitle flag is set.
100         * The image "exclude" (typically the current image) is not included 
101         * in the returned array (pass null to exclude no image).
102         * 
103         * @param sortByTitle set {@code true} to return images sorted by title
104         * @param exclude reference to an image to be excluded (may be {@code null})
105         * @return a (possibly empty) array of {@link ImagePlus} objects
106         */
107        public static ImagePlus[] getOpenImages(boolean sortByTitle, ImagePlus exclude) {
108                List<ImagePlus> imgList = new LinkedList<ImagePlus>();
109                int[] wList = WindowManager.getIDList();
110        if (wList != null) {
111                for (int i : wList) {
112                    ImagePlus imp = WindowManager.getImage(i);
113                    if (imp != null && imp != exclude) {
114                        imgList.add(imp);
115                    }
116                }
117        }
118        ImagePlus[] impArr = imgList.toArray(new ImagePlus[0]);
119        if (sortByTitle) {
120                Comparator<ImagePlus> cmp = new Comparator<ImagePlus>() {
121                        public int compare(ImagePlus impA, ImagePlus impB) {
122                                return impA.getTitle().compareTo(impB.getTitle());
123                        }
124                };
125                Arrays.sort(impArr, cmp);
126        }
127                return impArr;
128        }
129        
130
131        /**
132         *  Queries the user for an arbitrary file to be opened.
133         *  
134         * @param title string to be shown in the interaction window.
135         * @return path of the selected resource.
136         */
137        public static String askForOpenPath(String title) {
138                OpenDialog od = new OpenDialog(title, "");
139                String dir = od.getDirectory();
140                String name = od.getFileName();
141                if (name == null)
142                        return null;
143                return encodeURL(dir + name);
144        }
145        
146        private static String encodeURL(String url) {
147                //url = url.replaceAll(" ","%20");      // this doesn't work with spaces
148                url = url.replace('\\','/');
149                return url;
150        }
151        
152        //----------------------------------------------------------------------
153        
154
155        /**
156         * Creates an ImageJ {@link ImagePlus} image for the matrix {@code M[r][c]} (2D array),
157         * where {@code r} is treated as the row (vertical) coordinate and
158         * {@code c} is treated as the column (horizontal) coordinate.
159         * Use {@code show()} to display the resulting image.
160         * 
161         * @param title image title
162         * @param M 2D array
163         * @return a new {@link ImagePlus} image
164         */
165        public static ImagePlus createImage(String title, float[][] M) {
166                FloatProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(M[0].length, M.length);
167                for (int u = 0; u < M[0].length; u++) {
168                        for (int v = 0; v < M.length; v++) {
169                                fp.setf(u, v, M[v][u]);
170                        }
171                }
172                return new ImagePlus(title, fp);
173        }
174        
175
176        /**
177         * Creates an ImageJ {@link ImagePlus} image for the matrix {@code M[r][c]} (2D array),
178         * where {@code r} is treated as the row (vertical) coordinate and
179         * {@code c} is treated as the column (horizontal) coordinate.
180         * Use {@code show()} to display the resulting image.
181         * 
182         * @param title the image title
183         * @param M a 2D array holding the image data
184         * @return a new {@link ImagePlus} instance
185         */
186        public static ImagePlus createImage(String title, double[][] M) {
187                FloatProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(M[0].length, M.length);
188                for (int u = 0; u < M[0].length; u++) {
189                        for (int v = 0; v < M.length; v++) {
190                                fp.setf(u, v, (float) M[v][u]);
191                        }
192                }
193                return new ImagePlus(title, fp);
194        }
195        
196        /**
197         * Sets the weighing factors for the color components used
198         * in RGB-to-grayscale conversion for the specified image {@code ip}.
199         * Note that this method can be applied to any {@link ImageProcessor}
200         * instance but has no effect unless {@code ip} is of type
201         * {@link ColorProcessor}. Applies standard (ITU-709) weights.
202         * 
203         * @param ip The affected image
204         */
205        public static void setRgbConversionWeights(ImageProcessor ip) {
206                setRgbConversionWeights(ip, 0.299, 0.587, 0.114);
207        }
208        
209        /**
210         * Sets the weighing factors for the color components used
211         * in RGB-to-grayscale conversion for the specified image {@code ip}.
212         * Note that this method can be applied to any {@link ImageProcessor}
213         * instance but has no effect unless {@code ip} is of type
214         * {@link ColorProcessor}.
215         * 
216         * @param ip The affected image
217         * @param wr Red weight
218         * @param wg Green weight
219         * @param wb Blue weight
220         */
221        public static void setRgbConversionWeights(ImageProcessor ip, double wr, double wg, double wb) {
222                if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor) {
223                        ((ColorProcessor) ip).setRGBWeights(wr, wg, wb);
224                }
225        }
226        
227        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
228        
229        /** 
230         * Returns a copy of the pixel data as a 2D double
231         * array with dimensions [x = 0..width-1][y = 0..height-1].
232         * @param fp the image
233         * @return the resulting array
234         */
235        public static double[][] toDoubleArray(FloatProcessor fp) {
236                final int width = fp.getWidth();
237                final int height = fp.getHeight();
238                float[] fPixels = (float[]) fp.getPixels();
239                double[][] dPixels = new double[width][height];
240                int i = 0;
241                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
242                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
243                                dPixels[u][v] = fPixels[i];
244                                i++;
245                        }
246                }
247                return dPixels;
248        }
249        
250        /**
251         * Creates a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance of size width x height
252         * from the given 2D array with dimensions [x = 0..width-1][y = 0..height-1].
253         * 
254         * @param A a 2D {@code double} array
255         * @return a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance
256         */
257        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(double[][] A) {
258                final int width = A.length;
259                final int height = A[0].length;
260                float[] fPixels = new float[width * height];
261                int i = 0;
262                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
263                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
264                                fPixels[i] = (float) A[u][v];
265                                i++;
266                        }
267                }
268                return new FloatProcessor(width, height, fPixels);
269        }
270        
271        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(float[][] A) {
272                final int width = A.length;
273                final int height = A[0].length;
274                float[] fPixels = new float[width * height];
275                int i = 0;
276                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
277                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
278                                fPixels[i] = A[u][v];
279                                i++;
280                        }
281                }
282                return new FloatProcessor(width, height, fPixels);
283        }
284        
285        public static float[][] toFloatArray(FloatProcessor fp) {
286                final int w = fp.getWidth();
287                final int h = fp.getHeight();
288                float[][] A = new float[w][h];
289                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
290                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
291                                A[u][v] =  fp.getf(u, v);
292                        }
293                }
294                return A;
295        }
296        
297        /**
298         * Creates and returns a new {@code ByteProcessor} from
299         * the specified 2D {@code byte} array, assumed to be
300         * arranged in the form {@code A[x][y]}, i.e.,
301         * the first coordinate is horizontal, the second vertical.
302         * Thus {@code A.length} is the width and {@code A[0].length}
303         * the height of the resulting image.
304         * 
305         * @param A a 2D {@code byte} array
306         * @return a new {@code ByteProcessor} of size {@code A.length} x {@code A[0].length}
307         */
308        public static ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(byte[][] A) {
309                final int w = A.length;
310                final int h = A[0].length;
311                ByteProcessor bp = new ByteProcessor(w, h);
312                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
313                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
314                                bp.putPixel(u, v, 0xFF & A[u][v]);
315                        }
316                }
317                return bp;
318        }
319        
320        public static byte[][] toByteArray(ByteProcessor bp) {
321                final int w = bp.getWidth();
322                final int h = bp.getHeight();
323                byte[][] A = new byte[w][h];
324                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
325                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
326                                A[u][v] =  (byte) (0xFF & bp.get(u, v));
327                        }
328                }
329                return A;
330        }
331        
332        public static ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(int[][] A) {
333                final int w = A.length;
334                final int h = A[0].length;
335                ByteProcessor bp = new ByteProcessor(w, h);
336                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
337                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
338                                int val = A[u][v];
339                                if (val < 0)
340                                        val = 0;
341                                else if (val > 255) 
342                                        val = 255;
343                                bp.putPixel(u, v, val);
344                        }
345                }
346                return bp;
347        }
348        
349        /**
350         * Opens the image from the specified {@link URI} and returns it
351         * as a {@link ImagePlus} instance.
352         * 
353         * @param uri the URI leading to the image (including extension)
354         * @return A new {@link ImagePlus} instance or {@code null} if not found
355         */
356        public static ImagePlus openImage(URI uri) {
357                Objects.requireNonNull(uri);
358                return new Opener().openImage(uri.toString());
359        }
360        
361        
362        // Methods for checking/comparing images (primarily used for testing)  ---------------------
363        
364        /**
365         * Checks if two images are of the same type.
366         * 
367         * @param ip1 the first image
368         * @param ip2 the second image
369         * @return true if both images have the same type
370         */
371        public static boolean sameType(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
372                return ip1.getClass().equals(ip2.getClass());
373        }
374        
375        /**
376         * Checks if two images have the same size.
377         * 
378         * @param ip1 the first image
379         * @param ip2 the second image
380         * @return true if both images have the same size
381         */
382        public static boolean sameSize(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
383                return ip1.getWidth() == ip2.getWidth() && ip1.getHeight() == ip2.getHeight();
384        }
385        
386        /**
387         * Checks if the given image is possibly a binary image. This requires that
388         * the image contains at most two different pixel values, one of which
389         * must be zero. All pixels are checked.
390         * This should work for all image types.
391         * More efficient implementations are certainly possible.
392         * 
393         * @param ip the image ({@link ImageProcessor}) to be checked
394         * @return true if the image is binary
395         */
396        public static boolean isBinary(ImageProcessor ip) {
397                final int width = ip.getWidth();
398                final int height = ip.getHeight();
399                int fgVal = 0;
400                boolean binary = true;
401                
402                outer:
403                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
404                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
405                                int val = 0x007FFFFF & ip.get(u, v); // = mantissa in case of float
406                                if (val != 0) {
407                                        if (fgVal == 0) {       // first non-zero value
408                                                fgVal = val;
409                                        }
410                                        else if (val != fgVal) {        // found another non-zero value
411                                                binary = false;
412                                                break outer;
413                                        }
414                                }
415                        }
416                }
417                
418                return binary;
419        }
420        
421        /**
422         * Checks if the given image is "flat", i.e., all pixels have
423         * the same value.
424         * This should work for all image types.
425         * 
426         * @param ip the image ({@link ImageProcessor}) to be checked
427         * @return true if the image is flat
428         */
429        public static boolean isFlat(ImageProcessor ip) {
430                final int width = ip.getWidth();
431                final int height = ip.getHeight();
432                boolean flat = true;
433                int fgVal = ip.get(0, 0);
434                
435                outer:
436                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
437                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
438                                int val = ip.get(u, v);
439                                if (val != fgVal) {
440                                        flat = false;
441                                        break outer;
442                                }
443                        }
444                }
445                
446                return flat;
447        }
448        
449        /**
450         * Collects all image coordinates with non-zero pixel values into an array
451         * of 2D points ({@link Pnt2d}).
452         * 
453         * @param ip an image (of any type)
454         * @return an array of 2D points
455         */
456        public static Pnt2d[] collectNonzeroPoints(ImageProcessor ip) {
457                List<Pnt2d> points = new ArrayList<>();
458                int M = ip.getWidth();
459                int N = ip.getHeight();
460                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
461                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
462                                int val = 0x007FFFFF & ip.get(u, v); // = mantissa in case of float
463                                if (val != 0) {
464                                        points.add(PntInt.from(u, v));
465                                }
466                        }
467                }
468                return points.toArray(new Pnt2d[0]);
469        }
470        
471        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
472        
473        public static final double DefaultMatchTolerance = 1E-6;
474        
475        /**
476         * Checks if two images have the same type, size and content (using 
477         * {@link #DefaultMatchTolerance}).
478         * 
479         * @param ip1 the first image
480         * @param ip2 the second image
481         * @return true if both images have the same type and content
482         */
483        public static boolean match(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
484                return match(ip1, ip2, DefaultMatchTolerance);
485        }
486        
487        /**
488         * Checks if two images have the same type, size and content (using 
489         * the specified tolerance). 
490         * 
491         * @param ip1 the first image
492         * @param ip2 the second image
493         * @param tolerance the matching tolerance
494         * @return true if both images have the same type, size and content
495         */
496        public static boolean match(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2, double tolerance) {
497                if (!sameType(ip1, ip2)) {
498                        return false;
499                }
500                if (!sameSize(ip1, ip2)) {
501                        return false;
502                }
503                
504                if (ip1 instanceof ByteProcessor) {
505                        byte[] p1 = (byte[]) ip1.getPixels();
506                        byte[] p2 = (byte[]) ip2.getPixels();
507                        return Arrays.equals(p1, p2);
508                }
509                else if (ip1 instanceof ShortProcessor) {
510                        short[] p1 = (short[]) ip1.getPixels();
511                        short[] p2 = (short[]) ip2.getPixels();
512                        return Arrays.equals(p1, p2);
513                }
514                else if (ip1 instanceof ColorProcessor) {
515                        int[] p1 = (int[]) ip1.getPixels();
516                        int[] p2 = (int[]) ip2.getPixels();
517                        return Arrays.equals(p1, p2);
518                }
519                
520                else if (ip1 instanceof FloatProcessor) {
521                        float[] p1 = (float[]) ip1.getPixels();
522                        float[] p2 = (float[]) ip2.getPixels();
523                        boolean same = true;
524                        final float toleranceF = (float) tolerance;
525                        for (int i = 0; i < p1.length; i++) {
526                                if (Math.abs(p1[i] - p2[i]) > toleranceF) {
527                                        same = false;
528                                        break;
529                                }
530                        }
531                        return same;
532                }
533
534                throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown processor type " + ip1.getClass().getSimpleName());
535        }
536        
537        // BitMap from/to ByteProcessor conversion
538        
539        public static BitMap convertToBitMap(ByteProcessor bp) {
540                return new BitMap(bp.getWidth(), bp.getHeight(), (byte[]) bp.getPixels());
541        }
542
543        public static ByteProcessor convertToByteProcessor(BitMap bitmap) {
544                byte[] pixels = bitmap.getBitVector().toByteArray();
545                return new ByteProcessor(bitmap.getWidth(), bitmap.getHeight(), pixels);
546        }
547        
548        public static void drawPoints(ImageProcessor ip, Pnt2d[] points, int value) {
549                for (int i = 0; i < points.length; i++) {
550                        Pnt2d p = points[i];
551                        if (p != null) {
552                                int u = p.getXint();
553                                int v = p.getYint();
554                                ip.putPixel(u, v, value);
555                        }
556                }
557        }
558        
559        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
560        
561        /**
562         * Runs the given {@link PlugInFilter} instance with empty argument string.
563         * @param pluginfilter an instance of {@link PlugInFilter} 
564         * @return true if no exception was thrown
565         */
566        public static boolean run(PlugInFilter pluginfilter) {
567                return run(pluginfilter, "");
568        }
569        
570        /**
571         * Runs the given {@link PlugInFilter} instance.
572         * @param pluginfilter an instance of {@link PlugInFilter} 
573         * @param arg argument passed to {@link PlugInFilter#setup(String, ImagePlus)}
574         * @return true if no exception was thrown
575         */
576        public static boolean run(PlugInFilter pluginfilter, String arg) {
577                try {
578                        new PlugInFilterRunner(pluginfilter, pluginfilter.getClass().getSimpleName(), arg);
579                } catch (Exception e) {
580                        return false;
581                }
582                return true;
583        }
584        
585        /**
586         * Runs the given {@link PlugIn} instance with empty argument string.
587         * @param plugin an instance of {@link PlugIn}
588         * @return true if no exception was thrown
589         */
590        public static boolean run(PlugIn plugin) {
591                return run(plugin, "");
592        }
593        
594        /**
595         * Runs the given {@link PlugIn} instance.
596         * @param plugin an instance of {@link PlugIn}
597         * @param arg argument passed to {@link PlugIn#run(String)}
598         * @return true if no exception was thrown
599         */
600        public static boolean run(PlugIn plugin, String arg) {
601                try {
602                        plugin.run(arg);
603                } catch (Exception e) {
604                        return false;
605                }
606                return true;
607        }
608        
609        // ------------------------------------------------------------------
610        
611        /**
612         * Run a {@link PlugInFilter} from the associated class with empty argument string.
613         * If the plugin's constructor is available, use method {@link #run(PlugInFilter)} instead.
614         * @param clazz class of the pluginfilter
615         * @return true if no exception was thrown
616         */
617        public static boolean runPlugInFilter(Class<? extends PlugInFilter> clazz) {
618                return runPlugInFilter(clazz, "");
619        }
620        
621        /**
622         * Run a {@link PlugInFilter} from the associated class.
623         * If the plugin's constructor is available, use method {@link #run(PlugInFilter, String)} instead.
624         * @param clazz class of the plugin
625         * @param arg argument string
626         * @return true if no exception was thrown
627         */
628        public static boolean runPlugInFilter(Class<? extends PlugInFilter> clazz, String arg) {
629                PlugInFilter thePlugIn = null;
630                try {
631                        thePlugIn = clazz.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
632                } catch (InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException
633                                | InvocationTargetException | NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException e) {
634                        throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());     // should never happen
635                }
636                return run(thePlugIn, arg);
637        }
638        
639        /**
640         * Run a {@link PlugIn} from the associated class with empty argument string.
641         * If the plugin's constructor is available, use method {@link #run(PlugIn)} instead.
642         * @param clazz class of the plugin
643         * @return true if no exception was thrown
644         */
645        public static boolean runPlugIn(Class<? extends PlugIn> clazz) {
646                return runPlugIn(clazz, "");
647        }
648        
649        /**
650         * Run a {@link PlugIn} from the associated class.
651         * If the plugin's constructor is available, use method {@link #run(PlugIn, String)} instead.
652         * @param clazz class of the plugin
653         * @param arg argument string
654         * @return true if no exception was thrown
655         */
656        public static boolean runPlugIn(Class<? extends PlugIn> clazz, String arg) {
657                PlugIn thePlugIn = null;
658                try {
659                        thePlugIn = clazz.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
660                } catch (InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException
661                                | InvocationTargetException | NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException e) {
662                        throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());     // should never happen
663                }
664                return run(thePlugIn, arg);
665        }
666
667}
